data.name: MountPathInfo
data.value: The mount path can either be a file or a drive. If you're using the GOG version it'll be the 'game.inst' file. If you have a disc image it is usually the .cue file. Otherwise use the drive letter of the game disc.

data.name: MountOption_FileInfo
data.value: Indicate that the mount path is a file

data.name: MountOption_DriveInfo
data.value: Indicate that the mount path is a drive or disc

data.name: DosBoxSettingsInfo
data.value: Setting one of the below options to disabled or empty will use the default value specified in the DosBox configuration file. If a specific configuration file has been specified in the settings it may overwrite some of the settings below.

data.name: DosBoxOptions_AspectCorrectionInfo
data.value: Do aspect correction, if your output method doesn't support scaling this can slow things down!

data.name: DosBoxOptions_MemorySizeInfo
data.value: Amount of memory DOSBox has in megabytes

data.name: DosBoxOptions_FrameskipInfo
data.value: How many frames DOSBox skips before drawing one

data.name: DosBoxOptions_FullscreenResInfo
data.value: What resolution to use for fullscreen: original or fixed size (e.g. 1024x768)

data.name: DosBoxOptions_WindowedResInfo
data.value: Scale the window to this size IF the output device supports hardware scaling

data.name: DosBoxOptions_ScalerInfo
data.value: Scaler used to enlarge/enhance low resolution modes

data.name: DosBoxOptions_CoreInfo
data.value: CPU Core used in emulation. Auto switches from normal to dynamic if appropriate.

data.name: DosBoxOptions_CyclesInfo
data.value: Amount of instructions DOSBox tries to emulate each millisecond. Setting this value too high results in sound dropouts and lags. You can also let DOSBox guess the correct value by setting it to max. The default setting (auto) switches to max if appropriate.

data.name: Config_LockResInfo
data.value: Locks the horizontal and vertical values to the ones of the current screen resolution

data.name: Config_FullscreenInfo
data.value: Makes the game run in fullscreen, otherwise it'll run in windowed mode

data.name: Config_TnLInfo
data.value: Uncheck this if there are graphical glitches in the game

data.name: Config_ControllerInfo
data.value: If your controller is not recognized you can enable controller support here

data.name: Config_ResolutionR2Info
data.value: If the widescreen support is not enabled the game will stretch if set to an aspect ratio other than 4:3

data.name: Config_WidescreenSupportInfo
data.value: Widescreen support ensures that the game is not stretched when running in an aspect ratio other than 4:3

data.name: Config_LanguageR2Info
data.value: This sets the default language selected when launching the game. The language can still be changed from the game menu.

data.name: Config_ControllerR2Info
data.value: If your controller is not recognized you can enable controller support here. This will remove any custom button mapping.

data.name: Config_ButtonMappingInfo
data.value: As the game doesn't allow native button remapping you change it here. This will not work for controllers.

data.name: Config_ResolutionRRRInfo
data.value: Setting the resolution to an aspect ratio other than 4:3 will stretch the game, even with the internal widescreen option turned on

data.name: Config_RRRScreenModeInfo
data.value: The screen mode options will behave differently depending on the selected resolution. Usually keeping the 4:3 mode enabled will allow the game not to be stretched on different aspect ratios.

data.name: Config_SaveDataLocationInfo
data.value: This will not change where the game saves its data. Use this only to specify the data location for the backup tool.

data.name: About_ProgramInfo
data.value: Rayman Control Panel is an open source community project created by RayCarrot. This software is a single free to use executable file with the intent to easily access settings and fixes for the various Rayman titles released for Windows. This is a growing project with more features planned on being added with future updates. The utilities and various configuration tools have been created with help from various members of the Rayman community, all credited below.

data.name: Help_CategoryHelp
data.value: Select a help page from the available categories to the left

data.name: Settings_UserLevelInfo
data.value: The user level determines which options and information is available in the application. The higher the user level, the more advanced options and information will be shown.

data.name: Settings_UserLevelNormalInfo
data.value: Normal user level - for users who want all the default features without any of the more advanced options or technical details

data.name: Settings_UserLevelAdvancedInfo
data.value: Advanced user level - for users who want more advanced features above the default ones, but without the technical details

data.name: Settings_UserLevelTechnicalInfo
data.value: Technical user level - for users who want more advanced features above the default ones as well as the technical details

data.name: Settings_UserLevelDebugInfo
data.value: Debug user level - for app developers and testers who want advanced debug options and information

data.name: Settings_DesignSuccessMessagesInfo
data.value: Show a message when an operation has succeeded

data.name: Settings_DesignShowAllGames
data.value: Show games which are not installed

data.name: Settings_DesignShowAllGamesInfo
data.value: Show all games on the games page, even if they are not installed

data.name: Settings_DesignShowGameDetailsInfo
data.value: Show detailed game information in the game options dialog

data.name: Settings_DesignShowTaskBarProgress
data.value: Show progress on task bar icon

data.name: Settings_DesignShowTaskBarProgressInfo
data.value: Show download progress on the taskbar icon

data.name: Settings_DebugExceptionLevelInfo
data.value: The exception level for displaying debug and trace information

data.name: Settings_GeneralCloseOnLaunch
data.value: Close application when launching a game

data.name: R1U_TPLSInfo
data.value: By default the PC version of Rayman features fewer tracks than the PlayStation version and does not have specific tracks for each part of the levels. By enabling this utility the game will run with the PlayStation soundtrack added on top instead.

data.name: R1U_TPLSInfo2
data.value: NOTE: This utility may not work on DOSBox versions 0.74-2 or higher. Version 0.74 will still work.

data.name: R1U_CompleteOSTInfo
data.value: Rayman Forever, including the GOG version, does not come with the complete soundtrack due to disc space originally not being available. This utility can replace the existing incomplete soundtrack with the complete one, or alternatively revert it back.

data.name: R2U_TranslationsInfo
data.value: Applying an unofficial translation will replace one of the in-game languages with the selected one. In most cases this will be the English one. The changes can at any time be reverted by applying the original version.

data.name: R3U_DirectPlayInfo
data.value: DirectPlay needs to be enabled in order to run Rayman 3. By default it is usually disabled on Windows 10.

data.name: R3U_DirectPlayErrorInfo
data.value: Run the program as administrator in order to set the DirectPlay status

data.name: RDU_ReplaceFilesInfo
data.value: Some versions of Rayman Designer, including Rayman Forever, have some of the RayKit files infected with a malware. Although it does not appear to be harmful, or even active, and GOG has confirmed there is no danger, you can still safely replace the files with their non-infected versions using this utility.

data.name: RDU_CreateConfigInfo
data.value: During some Rayman Designer installations the configuration file won't be created, causing the Mapper to give an error when launching. This utility will fix that issue by creating the configuration file if not present.

data.name: RLU_UbiRayInfo
data.value: UbiRay is a character not available in the game to play as, but still in the game files. This utility will modify your save file so that UbiRay is the selected character, thus allowing you to play as him.

data.name: RLU_UbiRayWarning
data.value: WARNING: This utility is experimental and might corrupt your save file. Always make a backup before using it.

data.name: ROU_HQVideosInfo
data.value: The video cutscenes in the PC version are compressed and in lower quality than in the console versions. This utility replaces those videos with the higher quality ones from the console versions.

data.name: ROU_HQVideosReplace
data.value: Replace with the high quality videos

data.name: ROU_HQVideosRevert
data.value: Revert back to the original videos

data.name: ROU_DebugCommandsInfo
data.value: Using any of the below debug commands allows the game to be launched in a debug environment, with the commands changing how the game runs.

data.name: ROU_DebugCommandsWarning
data.value: WARNING: Using these debug commands may corrupt your save file. Always make a backup before using them.

data.name: ROU_DebugCommandsInvincibilityInfo
data.value: This allows the player to not die when taking damage

data.name: ROU_DebugCommandsHideMouseInfo
data.value: This will hide the mouse pointer in the game menus

data.name: ROU_DebugCommandsMaxZoomInfo
data.value: This will max out the camera zoom

data.name: ROU_DebugCommandsFramerateInfo
data.value: This will set the framerate to run the game in

data.name: ROU_DebugCommandsMapInfo
data.value: This will allow a specific map to be loaded instead of the main menu upon starting the game

data.name: ROU_DebugCommandsLanguageInfo
data.value: This will change the language the game runs in

data.name: ROU_UpdateInfo
data.value: In case Rayman Origins has not been automatically updated to its latest version, 1.02, this utility can update it.

data.name: ExceptionMessageInfo
data.value: An exception has occurred in the application. Below is the available debug information for the current user level in the Carrot Framework.

data.name: Feedback_Text
data.value: Listening to the users feedback is very important for me as a developer. Therefor I would greatly appreciate if you could take a minute to answer some quick questions regarding the program. This will allow you to let me know if there are any features you are missing or don't like. Thanks!

data.name: FirstLaunchInfo_Title
data.value: Welcome to the Rayman Control Panel

data.name: FirstLaunchInfo_Header
data.value: Welcome to the Rayman Control Panel

data.name: FirstLaunchInfo_Text
data.value: This program allows quick and easy access to all your installed Rayman games on your computer. From here you'll be able to launch them and their configuration programs, configure them directly from this program with added options (such as button mapping, widescreen support and more) and backup/restore each game's save files. Missing any Rayman games on your computer? You can easily access the available digital shops to purchase them or use the disc installer to install from any disc. To get started, check the boxes you want below and press 'Continue' to get to the game selection menu.

data.name: GameOptions_UnsavedChanges
data.value: Your configuration changes have not been saved. Do you want to exit and discard them?

data.name: DowngradeWarning
data.value: You are using an older version of the program {0} compared to the version of the current app data {1}. This is not recommended and may cause compatibility issues. These may be fixed by resetting the app data for this program.

data.name: Help_RCP_Updates
Help_RCP_Compatibility
data.value: The minimum required version to run the program is Windows Vista, with Windows 7 or above being recommended.

data.name: Help_RCP_GameInstaller
data.value:
For games which support to be installed from a disc you can do so from the drop down menu of the game. Currently Rayman 2, Rayman M and Rayman Arena are the only supported games.
During the installation you will have to specify a directory to install to. The game will install in a sub-directory in the specified directory. For example, you choose to install Rayman 2 under C:\Ubisoft it will get installed under C:\Ubisoft\Rayman 2
For Rayman 2 the installer will replace the executable file with the one from the GOG version to allow the game to run without inserting the disc. This is done to avoid a common disc error which usually occurs during the later half of the game.
To uninstall one of the games installed using the game installer you simply have to delete the directory and its files. The game will not show up under installed programs due to not having an uninstaller.

data.name: Help_RCP_BackupRestore
data.value:
The program has a backup and restore feature for all supported games. The backups are stored in the documents folder by default, but the location can be changed in the settings.
The backups themselves are always stored in the '{0}' sub-directory. It is not recommended to manually modify these files.

data.name: Help_RCP_AppData
Help_RCP_LaunchArgs
data.value:
The Rayman Control Panel supports several launch arguments, mainly meant for debugging the application. Below is a complete list of the available launch arguments. The '-' character should always be included. The '{}' characters show that a custom variable can be used, in which case the '{}'should not be included.
-reset (Resets all app data before launch) -install {filePath} (Removes the installer from the specified path) -ul {userLevel} (sets the user level once the framework is built) -loglevel {logLevel} (sets the log level to log, default is Information)

data.name: Help_RCP_Debug
data.value: If a debugger is attached to the program the log viewer will automatically open. This can manually be opened from the debug page even without a debugger being attached. If the debug user level is not enabled, the log can still be viewed from the file it writes to under the following path: {0}

data.name: Help_Games_General_GameNotLaunching
data.value:
Here are the two most common things to try out if a game won't launch:
*Run the game as administrator: The option to run a program as administrator can be found in the context menu by right-clicking the program.
*Run the game in compatibility mode: Running an application in compatibility mode is done by selecting the option under the compatibility options in the file properties. For many older games it is recommended to select Windows XP Service Pack 2 or 3.

data.name: Help_Games_R1_Emulator
data.value: Rayman 1, and most of its PC spin-offs (including Rayman Designer, Rayman by his Fans and Rayman 60 Levels) are MS-DOS programs and are not compatible with modern versions of Windows. Running them requires a DOS emulator, such as DosBox. Currently DosBox is the only supported emulator by the Rayman Control Panel.

data.name: Help_Games_R1_InstallationFailed
data.value: If one of the Rayman 1 based installers fail when it has finished installing it will delete the installed game if you cancel in the installer. To prevent this, force close the installer using task manager. The game will most likely still be installed. If any files are missing, copy them over from the disc manually.

data.name: Help_Games_R1_Mapper
data.value: Rayman Designer, also known as Rayman Gold or Rayman's World, is the Rayman game which includes the Mapper program which is used to create your own levels. The Mapper is a normal Windows executable file and will run without the need of an emulator. All of the static parts of the level are created in the Mapper program, while all of the so-called 'events' are placed in the event editor (found within the game itself).

data.name: Help_Games_R1_ImportMaps
data.value: Importing maps is done in the Mapper program. If an error occurs when doing so you can try moving the map file to the RayKit directory and importing it from there.

data.name: Help_Games_R2_GameSpeed
data.value: If Rayman 2 is running too fast while using nGlide, change the refresh rate to 120hz. This should be done even on monitors which do not support 120hz.

data.name: Help_Games_R2_Fps
data.value: Some parts of the game may not work if the game is running in 60fps. The most notable issue is during the bonus games where the timing difference will make it nearly impossible to win. Another side effect may be not being able to jump off of Umber's head in the Sanctuary of Stone and Fire.

data.name: Help_Games_R2_NoDisc
data.value: On disc versions of the game there is a known issue where the game will display a CD error during gameplay. This issue is not present in the GOG version. If the game is installed using the Rayman Control Panel installer the game will be patched to avoid the disc check like the GOG version, avoiding this issue entirely.

data.name: Help_Games_RMA_MissingTextures
data.value: If textures are missing in the game while using an Intel graphics card, try turning off Transform and Lightning.

data.name: Help_Games_RRR_EngineError
data.value: There is currently no fix for this error. This appears in all versions, including the GOG version, on certain computers.

data.name: Help_Games_RL_LoadError
data.value: The error occurs mainly on Windows 10 devices due to the game not being able to read/write to the game save file and/or the game configuration settings. The most common fix involves adding Rayman Legends as an exception to the Controlled Folder Access section of the built-in Windows Security system.

data.name: Help_Cheats_R1
data.value: • 99 lives - type trj8p or raylives or [TAB]bertrand during gameplay • All fist power-ups - type 2x2rmfmf or goldfist or [TAB]antoine during gameplay • All normal powers - type en5gol2g or power or [TAB]benoit during gameplay • Full health - type kom0ogdk or raypoint or [TAB]christ during gameplay • 10 added Tings - type 86e40g91 or raywiz or [TAB]jojo during gameplay • Skip current level section - type o8feh or winmap or [TAB]cyril during gameplay • Display hidden message - type [TAB]program during gameplay • Free movement - type [TAB];overay[BACKSPACE] during gameplay • 100MHz Refresh rate - type freq10 on the map • 80MHz Refresh rate - type freq80 on the map • All normal powers - type power or [TAB]benoit on the map • Lens effect - type lens on the map • Unlock all levels - type 4ctrepfj or alworld or [TAB]francois on the map • Enter Breakout minigame - type b76b7081 or cbray or [TAB]olivier on the map once Mr Dark's Dare has been completed • Enter random stage from Breakout minigame - type [TAB]cbrayal[BACKSPACE] on the map • Stage selection - type [TAB]alevel[BACKSPACE] on the map

data.name: Help_Cheats_RD
data.value: • 5 lives - type [TAB]lives05[BACKSPACE] during gameplay • 20 lives - type [TAB]lives20[BACKSPACE] during gameplay • 50 lives - type [TAB]lives50[BACKSPACE] during gameplay *All fist power-ups - type [TAB]goldens during gameplay • Finish level - type [TAB]finishing during gameplay • Full health - type [TAB]points during gameplay • Map number display - type [TAB]map[BACKSPACE] during gameplay • Free movement - type [TAB]moveray[BACKSPACE] during gameplay • Unlock all levels - type [TAB]openall[BACKSPACE] on the map

data.name: Help_Cheats_R2
data.value: • Upgrade magic fist - type glowfist on the pause screen • Restore health - type gimmelife on the pause screen • Gain 5 Yellow Lums - type gimmelumz on the pause screen • Go to any level - type gothere on the pause screen, select a level with the arrow keys and press enter • Unlock grappling power - type hangon on the pause screen • Gain maximum health - press and release the J key to the rhythm of the Rayman 2 theme • Enter bonus level without all Lums and Cages - press the A, Numpad 0, Q, W, Q, W in order followed by enter on the Access Denied screen *Skip cutscenes - type NOMOVIES on the pause screen • New loading screens - type ALLVIGN on the pause screen • Disable Murfy - type NOMOREMURFY on the pause screen • Access hidden area in Tomb of the Ancients - In the final part of the Tomb of the Ancients, stand on the third panel away from the entrance to the Technical Check-up where Rayman fights Clark. Type PLAYJEFF and jump on the crate to the hole in the wall. • Access Menezis - type SHOOTEMUP during the credits • Unknown - type GETELIX on the pause screen

data.name: Help_Cheats_RMA
data.value:
• Skip cutscenes - type esc during the cutscene • Unlock all battle levels - enter ALLFISH as a profile name and press Shift + Ctrl + Alt • Unlock all race levels - enter ALLTRIBES as a profile name and press Shift + Ctrl + Alt • Unlock all levels - enter ALLRAYMANM as a profile name and press Shift + Ctrl + Alt • Unlock all characters - enter PUPPETS as a profile name and press Shift + Ctrl + Alt • Unlock all skins - enter CARNIVAL as a profile name and press Shift + Ctrl + Alt • Unlock all battle levels in mode 1 - enter ARENAS as a profile name and press Shift + Ctrl + Alt • Unlock all race levels in mode 1 - enter TRACKS as a profile name and press Shift + Ctrl + Alt • Unlock all levels in mode 1 - enter FIELDS as a profile name and press Shift + Ctrl + Alt • Ragtime music in races - enter OLDTV as a profile name and press Shift + Ctrl + Alt • Reverse map - type reverse on the keyboard during gameplay
• Music team: To activate it, enter race mode and pause the game. On the pause screen, hold L1 + R1 (or equivalent on the currently used controller), then press the optimize button. Five blue balls will appear at the bottom of the screen. Release everything and press Jump. The player should hear a high pitched "Ding" sound, and after 0.5 seconds, the first ball should turn yellow. As soon as the ball turns yellow, hold Jump. The second ball should then turn yellow. As soon as the second ball turns yellow, release Jump. The third ball should then turn yellow. As soon as the third ball turns yellow, hold Jump again. The fourth ball should then turn yellow. As soon as the fourth ball turns yellow, release Jump. The player should be taken to the "Music Mode" screen where the player will be able to choose "Music Team".

data.name: Help_Cheats_R3
data.value: • Skip cutscenes - type esc during the cutscene • Reverse map - type reverse on the keyboard during gameplay

data.name: GameOptions_LaunchModeInfo
data.value: This determines how the game will be launched. If the game is running inside of an emulator, such as DOSBox, then the launch mode will apply to the emulator.

data.name: Settings_DesignAnimationsInfo
data.value: Animations include page transitions and resizing animations for the Games page

data.name: GameOptions_LaunchMode_AsInvokerInfo
data.value: Always runs the game with the same permissions as the Rayman Control Panel was launched with

data.name: GameOptions_LaunchMode_AsAdminOptionInfo
data.value: Same as Default, but with the option to run the game as administrator

data.name: GameOptions_LaunchMode_AsAdminInfo
data.value: Always attempts to run the game as administrator

data.value: An error occurred when saving. Not all changes have been saved.
